edu.cmu.lti.oaqa.bio.resource_wrapper.cache

Class DBCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cmu.lti.oaqa.bio.resource_wrapper.cache.DBCache

  • public class DBCache
extends java.lang.Object
    Database Cache Layer. Uses ResourceDBWrapper to interface with the database. Sits between the ReourceDataAccessObjects and the database, handles all interactions therein.
    Version:
    0.1.1
    Author:
    Collin McCormack (cmccorma)

      Constructor that accepts a DBInfo object of database login information.

                       java.lang.String valueTerm)

        Parameters:
        term - String subject term component
        relationship - String verb relationship component
        valueTerm - String object term component

      • IDinCache

        public boolean IDinCache(java.lang.String id)
        Is the specified id in the database already? (relationship="ID" and valueTerm=id) id should be in the form "Authority:2349789"
        Parameters:
        id - the fully qualified ID to look for
        Returns:
        true if it's already there, false if not (or on SQL error)

      • addTerm

        private boolean addTerm(java.lang.String term)
        Add a term to the database. Checks for existence of the term before attempting insertion. Returns true if the term is in the db (was there already or was inserted), false otherwise Only the primary term is added to the db here, all relationships are ignored. If you want to add the whole Term object, use addWholeTerm(Term).
        Parameters:
        term - String to be added to the db
        Returns:
        boolean for existence of the term in the db
        See Also:
        addWholeTerm(Term)

      • addWholeTerm

        public boolean[] addWholeTerm(Term term)
        Add a Term and it's contents to the database. Checks for existence of the term or it's constituent TermRelationships before attempting insertion. Returns true if the term is in the db (was there already or was inserted), false otherwise
        Parameters:
        term - Term object to be added to the db
        Returns:
        boolean array for existence of the Term and TermRelationships

      • addRelationship

        public boolean addRelationship(TermRelationship tr)
        Add a relationship to the database. Checks for existence of the relationship before attempting insertion. Automatically inserts terms into Terms table if they're absent. Returns true if the relationship is in the db (was there already or was inserted), false otherwise
        Parameters:
        tr - new TermRelationship
        Returns:
        boolean for existence of the TermRelationship in the db

                                double confidence,
                                Origin origin,

      • getRelationshipsByOrigin

        public java.util.ArrayList<TermRelationship> getRelationshipsByOrigin(java.lang.String term,
                                                                      Origin origin)
        Get TermRelationships pertaining to the specified term that also originated at the specified source.
        Parameters:
        term - String term
        origin - canonical Origin
        Returns:
        ArrayList of TermRelationships originating from the provided source

      • getAllRelationships

        public java.util.ArrayList<TermRelationship> getAllRelationships(java.lang.String term)
        Convenience method for getRelationshipsByOrigin(String, Origin) for Origin.ALL.
        Parameters:
        term - String term
        Returns:
        ArrayList of all TermRelationships pertaining to term, regardless of source

      • getTerm

        public Term getTerm(java.lang.String termQuery,
                    Origin origin)
        Get a complete Term object from the database. Tests for whether the primary term exists in the database first (though, ideally, this should be done before this method is called). If it doesn't exist, null is returned. If the term is present then all relationships that originated from the specified origin (Origin.ALL for all) are gathered and added to the Term, which is returned.
        Parameters:
        termQuery - String, the desired term (searched exactly)
        origin - Origin to match
        Returns:
        complete Term (null on error or no term found)

      • getTerm

        public Term getTerm(java.lang.String termQuery)
        Same as getTerm(String, Origin), but conveniently specifies Origin.ALL for origin.
        Parameters:
        termQuery - String, the desired term (searched exactly)
        Returns:
        complete Term (null on error or no term found)

      • getTermByID

        public Term getTermByID(java.lang.String id,
                        Origin origin)
        Retrieves the complete Term object corresponding to the supplied ID
        Parameters:
        id - fully-qualified String ID e.g. "Authority:236789"
        origin - Origin to retrieve from, (Origin.ALL for all)
        Returns:
        complete Term object

      • searchTerms

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> searchTerms(java.lang.String termQuery)

      • searchTerms

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> searchTerms(java.lang.String termQuery,
                                                         Origin source)

      • getDBWrapper

        public ResourceDBWrapper getDBWrapper()
        Retrieves the resources database wrapper. This should only be used for extreme, one-off cases. Do not use this to execute commands regularly!
        Returns:
        ResourceDBWrapper object pointing to the resources database
